SENT.plain: A 64-year-old woman suddenly had an attack of confusion and amnesia that suggested transient global amnesia
However, her loss of memory for recent events lasted more than ten days and was accompanied by psychomotor agitation and transient alteration of sexual behavior
The patient had no other neurologic signs during the episode
She recovered completely from the recent memory deficit, but was left with a persistent retrograde amnesia for a period of five to ten years and total amnesia for the acute episode
The EEG was suggestive of a left medial temporal lobe lesion
